YLKI Dukung BPJS Tertibkan Peserta Bayar Iuran Kesehatan
03 Nov 2019, 07:38 by Mosita Dwi Septiasputri


YLKI Dukung BPJS Tertibkan Peserta Bayar Iuran Kesehatan

KBRN, Jakarta : Pengurus Harian Yayasan Lembaga Konsumen Indonesia (YLKI) Daryatmo mendukung Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial atau BPJS Kesehatan untuk menertibkan konsumen BPJS yang dinilai mampu tapi masih menunggak atau tidak mau bayar.Ia mengatakan bahwa sebaiknya semua pihak harus menghindari kata 'Debt Collector'. Sebab ia menilai BPJS hanya sekedar ingin menertibkan para peserta yang dinilai mampu tapi tak mau membayar."Sebaiknya dihindari menggunakan kata-kata debt collector, karena konteksnya agak beda. Kalau debt collector itu kan konsumen pinjam uang tapi tidak bayar, kalau ini kan iuran BPJS itu agak beda, bukan konsumen tetapi peserta, mereka bukan minjam tapi dia bagian dari komitmen untuk membayar iuran BPJS," katanya kepada RRI, Minggu (3/11/2019).Menurutnya BPJS jika ingin melibatkan orang ketiga harus melakukan riset terlebih dahulu. Jadi, jika peserta yang benar tidak mampu membayar seharusnya BPJS mempunyai solusi tersendiri."Mestinya BPJS punya profiling, peserta BPJS yang menunggak jadi paling tidak ada dua, ia menunggak itu karena tidak mampu, kedua ia menunggak mampu tapi tidak mau bayar, nah mestinya kan diliat," katanya."Kalau yang tidak mampu itu mau dipakai kaya apa ya namanya juga tidak mampu. Ya, kita merekomendasikan untuk kepesertaannya itu di pindah ke peserta penerima bantuan iuran. Nah, untuk yang mampu tapi tidak mau bayar,ini harus dilakukan pendekatan supaya dia melakukan kewajiban membayar iuran," tutupnya.Sebelumnya, terkait banyaknya peserta BPJS yang masih menunggak pembayaran premi, BPJS Kesehatan terus melakukan sosialisasi bahkan penagihan langsung kepada 15 juta peserta.Penagihan tersebut dilakukan melalui para relawan yang menjadi kader Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional (JKN). Sampai Juni 2019 lalu, terhitung jumlah kader relawan ini hingga mencapai 3.288 orang.Kepala Humas BPJS Kesehatan Muhammad Iqbal Anas Ma'ruf menyebut, sistem kerja para relawan dilakukan dengan menggunakan tele-collecting, menelpon hingga SMS ke para peserta yang menunggak. Cara kerjanya bisa dibilang mirip dengan debt collector atau para penagih utang.Walaupun kader JKN melakukan penagihan layaknya seorang 'debt collector', Iqbal menjelaskan relawan ini tidak diperkenankan meminta uang secara langsung. Namun, peserta akan diarahkan ke tempat pembayaran resmi.

YLKI Supports BPJS Regulates Participants to Pay Health Contributions
03 Nov 2019, 07:38 by Mosita Dwi Septiasputri


YLKI Supports BPJS Regulates Participants to Pay Health Contributions

KBRN, Jakarta: Daily Organizer of the Indonesian Consumers Foundation (YLKI) Daryatmo supports the Social Security Organizing Agency or BPJS Health to curb BPJS consumers who are considered capable but still in arrears or unwilling to pay. He said that all parties should avoid the word 'Debt Collector' . Because he considered BPJS only wanted to curb the participants who were considered capable but did not want to pay. "It should be avoided using the words debt collector, because the context is somewhat different. If the debt collector is a consumer borrowing money but not paying, if this is BPJS contributions "It's a bit different, not consumers but participants, they are not borrowed, but they are part of the commitment to pay BPJS contributions," he told RRI on Sunday (11/03/2019). According to BPJS, if you want to involve a third person, you must research first. So, if the true participant cannot afford it, BPJS should have its own solution. "BPJS should have profiling, there are at least two BPJS participants who are in arrears, they are delinquent because they are unable, both of them are delinquent, but they don't want to pay, right? diliat, "he said." If those who can not afford it want to be used rich what name is also not able to. Yes, we recommend for membership to be transferred to the beneficiary beneficiary participants. Well, for those who are able but do not want to pay, this must be approached so that he makes the obligation to pay dues, "he concluded. Previously, related to the number of BPJS participants who were still in arrears of premium payments, BPJS Health continued to socialize even direct billing to 15 million participants. The billing was done through volunteers who became cadres of the National Health Insurance (JKN) . Until June 2019, the number of volunteer cadres reached 3,288 people. Head of BPJS Health Public Relations Muhammad Iqbal Anas Ma'ruf said, the volunteer work system was carried out using tele-collecting, calling to SMS to participants in arrears. The way it works is arguably similar to debt collectors or debt collectors. Even though JKN cadres do billing like a 'debt collector', Iqbal explained that these volunteers were not allowed to ask for money directly. However, participants will be directed to the official payment point.
